resources.string:
Access: No renewals

Lending Period: 3 days

Location: Architecture & Fine Arts Library
Central Library
Science & Engineering Library

ELIGIBLE BORROWERS

Current UT Arlington faculty, staff and students are eligible to check out a laptop.

BORROWING A LAPTOP

You can borrow a laptop from Central, Science & Engineering, and Architecture & Fine Arts Service Desks for 3 days. Laptops can be used outside the libraries, but the wireless equipment will only work on campus in areas with access to the UT Arlington wireless network.

Laptops are available on a first-come first-serve basis and are non-renewable.

You can only borrow one laptop or tablet at a time.

When a laptop is borrowed, the individual doing so assumes full financial responsibility for the property.

Laptops must not be left unattended at any time. Any malfunctions should be reported to staff when the laptop is returned.

LAPTOP USE

When laptops are turned off and on after each circulation, laptops are returned to a default setting and any work done by the user is erased.

The Library is not responsible for any files left on any laptop or for loss of or damage to a users file during the loan period.

The Library is not responsible for any computer viruses that may be transferred to, or from, a users CD or DVD.

For help using laptops (both hardware and software), the borrower may seek assistance from the OIT Help Desk on the first floor of the Central Library.

REPLACEMENT CHARGES

A replacement charge for damage to or the loss of a laptop and/or its peripherals will be assessed as necessary. The estimated value of the equipment is $3000. A processing fee of $35 and overdue fines may also be incurred, depending upon circumstances.

Access: No renewals

Lending Period: 3 hours

Location: Architecture & Fine Arts Library
Central Library
Science & Engineering Library

ELIGIBLE BORROWERS

Current UT Arlington faculty, staff and students are eligible to check out a laptop.

BORROWING AN IPAD

You can borrow a tablet from Central, Science & Engineering, and Architecture & Fine Arts Service Desks for 4 hours. Tablets can be used outside the libraries, but the wireless equipment will only work on campus in areas with access to the UT Arlington wireless network.

Tablets are available on a first-come first-serve basis and are non-renewable. You can only borrow one tablet or laptop at a time.

You can only borrow one laptop or tablet at a time.

When a tablet is borrowed, the individual doing so assumes full financial responsibility for the property.

Tablets must not be left unattended at any time. Any malfunctions should be reported to staff when the tablet is returned.

IPAD USE

When an iPad is turned off and on after each circulation, iPads are returned to a default setting and any work done by the user is erased.

The Library is not responsible for any files left on any ipads or for loss of or damage to a users file during the loan period.

The Library is not responsible for any computer viruses that may be transferred to, or from, a users CD or DVD.

REPLACEMENT CHARGES

A replacement charge for damage to or the loss of a iPad and/or its peripherals will be assessed as necessary. The estimated value of the equipment is $500. A processing fee of $35 and overdue fines may also be incurred, depending upon circumstances.
